sources.full: One Shot Wonders - 10 Forest One Shot Adventures

data.name: Curtain Call

entries: {@b Thrilling. Investigation. Caravan Theatre.}

A travelling troupe's spectacular show stops suddenly when the body of its leader is found backstage. Before the party can tuck into their interval snacks, they are caught up in a murder investigation, and must use all of their analytical skills to find the calloused killer.

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: You purchased your tickets and took a seat on the front row to watch the Whimsy Ensemble perform within this sheltered forest glade. Bright caravans encircle the portable, wooden stage and lazily hanging lanterns give a warm light to the dim evening. The acclaimed show is about to begin.

Kacarosh welcomes the audience and introduces the first act, a group of dancers who perform a spectacular interpretation of a classic play. When they're done, the performers will head backstage and discover Kacarosh has been killed. One of the dancers will run back on stage, screaming, and inform everyone about Kacarosh's demise. As the rest of the audience flees, the party will be hired by the dancers to investigate the murder, with the promise of today's ticket sales as payment. The murderer has to be one of the three satyrs who weren't on stage at the time of the killing - Stiss, Stramo or Ginnish.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have the dancers plead with and hire the party to solve Kacarosh's murder, then continue:
{@b In the Spotlight}

items: The party are invited backstage to look for clues. Examining the body shows Kacarosh was stabbed.
The dancers suggest interviewing each suspect about their possible motivations. The three suspects will reluctantly agree to speak to the party.

entries: {@b Abode Analysis}

items: The party are encouraged to search each suspect's caravan for evidence. The order the party choose to search the homes determines who the murderer is.
In the first two caravans, any clues they find are misdirections, and there is no real evidence. In the third caravan, the murder weapon is found.

entries: {@b Out With a Bang}

items: After being revealed as the murderer, the owner of the third caravan attacks the party in a rage.
Upon seeing the evidence, the dancers will reward the party, but lament the difficult situation. They will ask the party what to do with the killer.

entries: {@b Kacarosh Gir}
{@i Satyr, Male, 41 ({@creature Satyr})}
The recently elected director of the Whimsy Ensemble. Kacarosh is outwardly known for being charming, articulate, humble and a talented dancer.
Kacarosh wears a spangled beret and a bright, matching waistcoat. He smiles with a wink.
{@b Stiss Gir}
{@i Satyr, Male, 37 ({@creature Spy})}
Stiss is fiercely jealous of his brother, Kacarosh, and hates how successful and beloved he has become.
Stiss's emerald eyes are striking, but slightly duller in shade than his brother's. He walks with a limp and occasionally rubs his knee.
{@b Stramo Doxchae}
{@i Satyr, Male, 42 ({@creature Spy})}
Stramo is Kacarosh's rival; the two regularly have heated disputes and can't stand one another.
Stramo is short in stature, but his pointy horns are ready to jab anyone who looks down on him. He seems to permanently wear an angry frown.
{@b Ginnish Simflaig}
{@i Satyr, Female, 26 ({@creature Spy})}
As Kacarosh's assistant, Ginnish is overworked and underpaid, and has grown to hate her employer.
Ginnish's cheerful purple waistcoat contrasts with her tired eyes and sour expression. Her hair is tied up in a bun and held by a pencil.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Stiss' Caravan}
Bright bunting and old posters of the troupe's previous shows hang from Stiss's caravan. His groomed mastiff is tied to the door's golden handle.

The {@creature Mastiff} is named Sleighbell and wears a jester's hat; it will try to stop the party gaining entry. Stiss often sits at his desk and writes hate mail about Kacarosh under false pen names, before posting it to the troupe.
{@b Stramo's Caravan}
Stramo's is the shabbiest of the caravans. Its chipped paintwork and split wood stand out amongst the others. Parchment nailed to its door tells visitors to leave him alone if he doesn't answer.

The floor is littered with screwed-up posters, each features Kacarosh's face crossed out with red ink. A {@creature Weasel} in the caravan will try to interrupt any investigation taking place. It lives in a mouldy tankard.
{@b Ginnish's Caravan}
A plaque above this caravan reads 'Assistant to Kacarosh'. Planters hang from its gabled roof, forming a well-tended garden of peonies.

A lockbox containing receipts for Kacarosh's lavish expenses and a journal of all the horrible things he has said is hidden in a cupboard. The key to the lockbox can be found on the ribbon collar of Ginnish's loyal Cat, Radish.

items: Kacarosh's lute can be found beside his body; the neck of the instrument has been broken.
Stiss's parents saw Kacarosh as the gifted sibling, and paid for him to have private tuition.
After failing a stunt that Kacarosh recommended, Stiss recently sustained a painful leg injury.
Stiss feels that Kacarosh purposely gives him the sideline roles to keep him out of the limelight.
As the better singer, Stramo was furious when Kacarosh was elected as the troupe's leader.
Stramo hates {@creature Weasel||Weasels}, but cannot get rid of the one Kacarosh released into his home as a prank.
During the leadership elections, Kacarosh spread a rumour that Stramo was stealing troupe funds.
Ginnish was hired as a harpist, but Kacarosh only ever gives her dull, administrative tasks.
Ginnish applied to join another troupe, but they declined after Kacarosh gave a bad reference.
Kacarosh threatened to reduce Ginnish's pay if she couldn't complete the impossible list of tasks he gave her.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: The Whimsy Ensemble will reward the party with today's ticket sales, totalling 87gp. If they are found to be the killer, Stiss drops a {@item Potion of Healing}, Stramo drops a Spell Scroll ({@spell Charm Person}), and Ginnish drops her floral {@item Bag of Holding}.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Harder}
The suspect could attack the party as a {@creature Werewolf} - perhaps they plotted to kill Kacarosh after he learnt their secret?
{@b Even Harder}
The suspect who killed Kacarosh could use the stats of a {@creature Mage} instead of a {@creature Spy}.

data.name: Light the Way

entries: {@b Adventurous. Delivery. Forest Road.}

Highway robbers are targeting travellers passing through a particularly dense, dark area of the forest. The council have commissioned a number of lamp posts to try and make the road safer. The final stage of installation requires placing glowing insects inside the lanterns.

"The council have employed you as temporary contractors, after an engineering project ran over schedule and the regular workers were moved on to another job. The workers were able to construct five metal lamp posts, each with a hanging glass lantern. However, they weren't able to install the glowing Giant Fire Beetles that provide the illumination."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Faulin explain the job and ask the party to sign a contract, then continue:
{@b Terms of Employment}

items: Faulin gives the party a map of the forest. The five lamp posts that need lighting are neatly marked.
Faulin shows the party to a cart that holds a crate of six {@creature Giant Fire Beetle||Giant Fire Beetles}, two spare glass lanterns and a stack of bounty posters to pin up.

entries: {@b Into the Dark}

items: Lamp 1: A {@creature Swarm of Wasps} are nesting within it; they must be removed before the lantern can be lit.
Lamp 2: A {@creature Giant Bat} attacks the {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}.
Lamp 3: The lamp post has been vandalised. The party must fix it, including replacing the lantern.
Lamp 4: This {@creature Giant Fire Beetle} is especially vicious!

entries: {@b Stand and Deliver}

items: Lamp 5: The party are ambushed by Tilde and Gregor, accompanied by two {@creature Mastiff||Mastiffs}. If the party subdue the robbers, they can take them back to the council offices and claim the reward.

entries: {@b Faulin Gawa}
{@i Human, Non-Binary, 52 ({@creature Commoner})}
Efficient Faulin explains the terms of the work in detail, reading from their clipboard at top speed.
{@b Tilde Krilheim}
{@i Human-Elf, Female, 34 ({@creature Tough|XMM})}
Forceful Tilde often bosses Gregor around. She carries a chunky crossbow and mace with ease.
{@b Gregor Hizzlefett}
{@i Halfling, Male, 34 ({@creature Bandit})}
While Tilde stands and confronts travellers, Gregor sneaks to flank them and cut off their escape.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Forest Path}

Most of the underbrush enjoys dappled sunshine, apart from an area of dense pines. The thickest part of the forest is shaded in darkness, so the party will need the ability to see in the dark or an alternative light source to guide their way.
{@b Lamp Posts}

Each lamp post is made of twisting metal poles and is 10 ft tall. A tear-shaped, glass lantern hangs on a curved hook at the top of each post. The base of each lantern can be opened to insert the {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}. It shuts with a latch and padlock.

items: The bounty posters offer a 75gp reward for anyone who delivers the two highway robbers to stand trial.
Tilde and Gregor want to destroy the lamp posts, as it is easier for them to attack from the shadows.
The council workers who installed the empty lamp posts were delayed by the robbers' sabotage efforts.
Each lantern comfortably houses a {@creature Giant Fire Beetle}, who will be regularly tended to by forest rangers.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Faulin will pay the party 10gp per lamp post they are able to get up-and-running, and the council will pay the 75gp bounty if Tilde and Gregor are handed into the authorities. If searched, Gregor has a Spell Scroll ({@spell Guidance}) stuffed into his back pocket.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Harder}: A grumpy {@creature Brown Bear} could be using a lamp post to scratch itself. Gregor could also be a {@creature Touch|XMM}.
{@b Even Harder}: Two {@creature Phase Spider||Phase Spiders} could attack during the journey. There could be three {@creature Bandit Captain||Bandit Captains} as robbers.

images.title: Light the Way - Dense Forest - Sparse (Grid)
Light the Way - Dense Forest Sparse (Gridless)

data.name: Unhappy Birthday

entries: {@b Light-Hearted. Acquisition. Forest Road.}

Traz wrote his birthday gift list extra early this year, to make sure his parents would get him what he wanted. But, when he doesn't receive anything from his list, he throws a giant-sized tantrum. The party are employed by Traz's fearful father to find the gifts and save the day!

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "As you travel the dusty road through the forest, the sound of distant thunder on a clear day sets you on edge. Turning a corner, you notice the true source of the rumbling sounds - the crashing footsteps of an enormous ogre who is trying to appease their stroppy child. Noticing you, the larger of the two ogres waves and trudges over to you."

The Ogre father, Orguk, recently smashed a merchant's cart to find a present for his son's upcoming birthday. He found a box of party hats and a wand that shoots fireworks, which he thought were perfect presents. But, Traz has been asking for the items on his birthday list for months, so is extremely unhappy with his 'stupid' wand. Orguk's partner, Jublub, has gone to collect Traz's friends for a celebration, and will be back in four hours. While he tries to comfort his son, Orguk asks the party to find the gifts before the celebration begins.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Orguk offer a reward for solving the predicament within four hours, then continue:
{@b Listing Priorities}

items: Traz's list has six items: a red-legged {@creature Frog} and honey mushrooms from a glade; his lost toy boat and a jar of butterbeetles from a bog; and a jasper necklace and a floppy hat belonging to Ham-Ham the merchant.
The party can travel to find the gifts in any order.

entries: {@b Gifts from the Glade}

items: Red-legged Frogs are very stealthy and agile, so are difficult to find and even harder to catch.
Delicious honey mushrooms often grow next to, or underneath, poisonous fungi that release spores.

entries: {@b Boons from the Bog}

items: Traz's lost toy boat sticks out of a patch of mud that six irritable {@creature Crocodile||Crocodiles} are using as a nest.
Butterbeetles produce yellow light, and live in hives at the top of trees. They attack as a swarm.

entries: {@b Tributes from the Trader}

items: Ham-Ham will sell the party a jasper necklace for 200gp (which is only worth 45gp).
There is no way that Ham-Ham will donate his hat, the party must think of a creative way to take it, or move on without it.

entries: {@b Birthday or Bust}

items: If the party return on time with four or more gifts, Traz is thankful and the celebration is a success!
If the party return late or with fewer than four gifts, Traz is upset and the celebration is ruined.

entries: {@b Orguk Bruk}
{@i Ogre, Male, 54 ({@creature Ogre})}
Agitated Orguk thinks he has failed Traz, so is eager to get help. He seems to only talk in a raised voice.
"A muscular ogre with a furrowed brow stands before you, wearing bearskin wraps around his waist. He holds multiple unwanted gifts."
{@b Traz Bruk}
{@i Ogre, Male, 10 ({@creature Ogre})}
Traz ignores anyone who tries to talk to him. He is upset because he feels like his birthday is ruined.
"Despite the party hat on his head, frowning Traz is clearly throwing a strop."
{@b Ham-Ham Shivtooth}
{@i Gnoll, Male, 24 ({@creature Gnoll})}
Ham-ham is dishonest and often cheats customers; he despises the Ogres for destroying his cart.
"This scruffy merchant is wearing a knitted cardigan with pockets full of trinkets. A wide-brimmed, floppy hat sits on his furry head."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Overgrown Glade}
"Deep in the forest lies a wild glade of long grasses, tall trees, berry bushes and a stream. The sounds of trickling water and rustling leaves add a calming feel to the space."

The glade is 30 minutes from Orguk, 30 minutes from the bog, and an hour from Ham-Ham's hut. Failed attempts to catch a {@creature Frog} or becoming {@condition poisoned} by the spores will waste the party's time.
{@b Bubbling Bog}
"Mud cakes your footwear as you squelch your way through the bog. Sticking to the sodden path where you can, you eventually get to the dirty lake that Orguk mentioned."

The bog is an hour from Orguk, 30 minutes from the glade, and 30 minutes from Ham-Ham's hut. Fights with both the {@creature Crocodile||Crocodiles} and {@creature Swarm of Beetles} will delay the party. The toy boat may sink into the mud during the battle and become hidden.
{@b Ham-Ham's Hut}
"A destroyed mercantile cart sits outside a shabby, wooden home. The abode leans to one side, showing both its age and its poor condition."

Ham-Ham's hut is 90 minutes from Orguk, an hour from the glade, and 30 minutes from the bog. Conversations with Ham-Ham won't take up too much time, but an elaborate plan to steal both his necklace and hat might.

items: Jublub asked Orguk to arrange Traz's gifts, and will not be happy if Traz is disappointed.
Everything on Traz's birthday gift list reminds him of a fun day he once spent playing in the forest.
Red-legged {@creature Frog||Frogs} hide in knotholes earlier in the day, and are more active in the later afternoon.
Honey mushrooms are popular with druids; they are often referred to as 'mud candy' by foragers.
Traz received the toy boat as a gift last year, and threw a big strop after losing it in the bog.
The {@creature Crocodile||Crocodiles} sleep all morning, and become a lot more energetic and aggressive later in the day.
Butterbeetle hives are made from harvested milk, and release a foul smell if disturbed or damaged.
Ham-Ham purchased his floppy hat in a faraway land. He thinks it makes him look handsome.
Ham-Ham stole his cart from a fellow merchant; the original owner's branding is still faintly visible.
Ham-Ham has been organising a group of {@creature Gnoll} bandits, and plans to attack Orguk for smashing his cart.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Orguk offers the party some shiny coins he took when he smashed Ham-Ham's cart (50gp per gift they find). Traz will personally thank the party if all of his gifts are received, and give them each a blue party hat and his 'stupid' {@item Wand of Magic Missiles}.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could remove the time constraints, and only have two {@creature Crocodile||Crocodiles} protecting the boat.
{@b Harder}
{@creature Gnoll} bandits employed by Ham-Ham could attack the party if his hat or necklace is stolen. You could replace the six Crocodiles with two {@creature Giant Crocodile||Giant Crocodiles}.

data.name: Surprise Guests

entries: {@b Thrilling. Defence. Ancient Temple.}

Fey and mortals have gathered together to celebrate a coming-of-age ceremony for a child, who will one day control an area of forest that bridges the two worlds. However, a distant relative wants to usurp that power for herself, and will disrupt the midnight ceremony to do so.

"Tonight, we gather under the light of the moon to celebrate the dedication of one young soul to the responsibilities she will one day inherit. As is custom, we are joined by strangers from the mortal realm, to stand as witnesses for their world and as a symbol of the continued goodwill between us. We thank them for accepting our invitation tonight..."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Tirrna give a speech to begin the coming-of-age ceremony, then continue:
{@b Vows Interrupted}

items: The party are asked to each present an item as a sentimental offering, and receive a flower in return.
As Rayne begins her vows, candles flicker out and multiple {@creature Guard||Guards} fall down into a magical slumber.
Tirrna instructs the guests to retreat into a lower sanctum. She asks the party to stand guard while her {@creature Centaur} bodyguard, Germail, aids the guests.

entries: {@b Ceremony Under Siege}

items: Waves of foes drop from the rafters and begin combat. Wave 1: two {@creature Swarm of Bats||Swarms of Bats}; Wave 2: two {@creature Darkmantle||Darkmantles}; and Wave 3: two {@creature Gargoyle||Gargoyles}.

entries: {@b Raising an Objection}

items: Nimh emerges at the altar from the Ethereal Plane, and demands the right to the title. As the party try to fend Nimh off, Tirrna, Rayne and Germail run over to help subdue her.
Once Nimh is stopped, Tirrna thanks the party, and the ceremony resumes outside in the forest.

entries: {@b Marquise Tirrna Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 364 ({@creature Drow})}
A fey noble who hopes her child will continue her policy of peace with the adjoining mortal lands.
{@b Rayne Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 16 ({@creature Drow})}
Sixteen-year-old Rayne is old enough to make the vows needed to be recognised as her mother's heir.
{@b Nimh Miadonis}
{@i Drow, Female, 412 ({@creature Night Hag})}
Nimh is Tirrna's second cousin and was in line for her title until Rayne became part of the family.

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Miadonis Grove}

The ancestral lands of the Miadonis family are an area of fey forest where the border with the mortal realm is particularly thin. Nimh wants to return to the old ways of their family, tricking and exploiting mortals who enter fey territory.
{@b Ancient Temple}

The ceremony venue is a small building. The dedication book sits on a central altar, in front of a flight of stairs leading to a lower sanctum. Moonlight trickles through stained-glass windows, but the high ceiling rafters are shrouded in darkness.

items: The party were pulled through a portal in an oak tree to attend the ceremony on behalf of all mortals.
During the ceremony, Rayne will sign her name into a magical book, which seals her inheritance.
Once Rayne's name is inscribed in the book, Nimh will face exile if she acts against her young cousin.
In a {@creature Drow} lifespan, 16 is extremely young, so Rayne is unlikely to inherit the title for many years.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: For saving the ceremony, Tirrna bestows a special fey blessing ({@spell Aid}) upon the party that lasts for the next 24 hours. She also gives them a small topaz heirloom gem (worth 500gp) presented in a velvet-lined chest.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could remove the {@creature Gargoyle||Gargoyles} from the attack in the temple, and Nimh could use {@creature Cultist Fanatic|XMM} stats.
{@b Harder}
Try adding a {@creature Gargoyle} into both Waves 1 and 2, then two {@creature Will-o'-Wisp||Will-o'-Wisps} into Wave 3. Nimh could be a {@creature Drider}.

data.name: Foes in the Foliage

entries: {@b Adventurous. Defence. Raintforest Clearing.}

Deep in the rainforest, a local {@creature Druid} has identified a tree that will soon awaken into a powerful, sentient {@creature Treant}. Knowing a group of territorial {@creature Dryad||Dryads} will do whatever it takes to stop the transformation, the {@creature Druid} has hired the party to protect the sacred sapling from harm.

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "Every inch of the forest is teeming with life. You can hear it in the buzz and whine of tiny insects that whizz past your ears, and in the distant roar of larger predators that lurk in the undergrowth. You can even smell it in the humid air. The {@creature druid} who hired you asked you to meet him near a patch of fenced-off bromeliad flowers; you spotted the landmark about an hour ago, but are yet to see any sign of him"

The wildlife of the rainforest traditionally live under the benevolent stewardship of a powerful {@creature Treant}. However, in the decades since the last {@creature Treant} guardian passed away, a group of territorial {@creature Dryad||Dryads} have risen to become the dominant force in the forest. With a new {@creature Treant} on the verge of awakening, the {@creature Dryad||Dryads} have hatched a plot to poison it before it has a chance to emerge. The party have been summoned by a {@creature Druid}, who is set on protecting this tree, after failing to save a potential {@creature Treant} in the past.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Lycaster walk out from the forest and give the party their task, then continue:
{@b Home Invasion}

items: Lycaster takes the party to his shelter to collect supplies, but they find it has been ransacked.
Maps leading to the {@creature Treant} have been stolen, and healing tinctures needed to protect it are smashed. The party must recover herbs and vials from within.

entries: {@b Healing Waters}

items: Lycaster needs to fetch a key ingredient to help make more tincture - water from a magical flower. The party must climb a tree to find it, avoiding a deadly {@creature Giant Constrictor Snake} in the branches.
With the water, Lycaster can make enough tincture for each player and himself to carry one dose.
Lycaster leads the group to the emerging {@creature Treant}.

entries: {@b Hold the Line}

items: As night falls, the {@creature Dryad||Dryads} attack in five waves:

Wave 1: Two {@creature Dryad||Dryads} step out of trees; Wave 2: a Dryad appears with a {@creature Panther} under its control; Wave 3: two {@creature Dryad||Dryads} drop down from the treetops; Wave 4: three {@creature Dryad||Dryads} appear and try to charm a party member; Wave 5: Helabor appears, flanked by two {@creature Dryad||Dryads} and two more Panthers.

Each Dryad tries to poison the tree. The tree can only take three doses of poison until it dies, but a dose of tincture nullifies a dose of poison. The tree will turn into a {@creature Treant} after five rounds.
If awakened, Pona the {@creature Treant} thanks the group and helps to attack any remaining {@creature Dryad||Dryads}.
When the danger passes, Lycaster gratefully thanks and pays the party.

entries: {@b Lycaster Cedrela}
{@i Human-Elf, Male, 95 ({@creature Druid})}
Lycaster is dedicated to preserving natural cycles within the forest, including the transfer of power.
"It is hard to tell where Lycaster ends and the forest begins. Colourful lichen grows over his clothing, helping him blend into the trees."
{@b Helabor Cattleya}
{@i Dryad, Female, 304 ({@creature Dryad})}
A highly trained warrior and spy, dead set on destroying Lycaster's store of healing tinctures.
"Pink and white orchids weave amongst the vibrant vines tumbling down her bark-like skin. She steps with a soft, but deadly, grace."
{@b Pona}
{@i Treant, Female, 150 ({@creature Treant})}
Prior to her awakening, she existed for 150 years as an unassuming mahogany tree.
"The tree's bark warps and settles into a kind face with soft eyes and an expressive smile."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Lycaster's Shelter}
"The small shelter was hidden, but clearly not well enough. Smashed clay containers lie on the floor, with liquid seeping out of them. There is a strong smell of rotting plants."

Lycaster's humble forest home is entirely made of natural materials. Helabor ransacked the shelter, she also released toxins into the air. When inhaled, the toxins act as if a {@spell Poison Spray} spell has been cast.
{@b Treetops}
"The tree boughs look strong, but they're slick with moss and moisture. Any climbers would need to be very careful to not plummet back to the forest floor."

The magical plant is bright-orange and easy to spot. Water collects in the petals, along with tiny frogs and tadpoles who swim in the small pools of shimmering liquid. The plant only grows in the highest branches, 20 ft above the ground.
{@b Emerging Treant}
"The strong, proud tree is draped with vines, and many colourful birds are perched on its sturdy branches. Even amidst all the other life in this rainforest, this tree seems to exert a special draw."
The tree is teaming with arcane energy, just waiting to awaken. As she emerges, Pona's branches extend into long fingertips and her trunk splits into two huge legs.

items: The stolen maps had footnotes on {@creature Treant} biology, and an estimation of when it would emerge.
The {@creature Dryad||Dryads}' herbicide uses a base of rootrot fungus, which is extremely toxic to plant life.
Helabor found the location of Lycaster's shelter by tracking the animals that visit him for food.
The {@creature Dryad||Dryads} see Lycaster as meddlesome, but not as significant a threat as an awakened {@creature Treant}.
The {@creature Treant} is vulnerable to poison in the moments before it emerges, as its magic briefly weakens.
The last time a {@creature Treant} was about to awaken, the {@creature Dryad||Dryads} {@condition poisoned} it, causing it to wither and die.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Lycaster offers the party 150gp to defend him and the awakening tree. If Pona awakens, Lycaster gifts the party an additional 100gp, and a bubbling {@item Potion of Animal Friendship} that he is able to brew for them back at his shelter.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could only have one {@creature Dryad} present in each wave, and remove the {@creature Panther||Panthers} from the fight.
{@b Harder}
Some of the {@creature Dryad||Dryads} could ride into battle on saddled {@creature Tiger||Tigers}; and Helabor could instead be a {@creature Green Hag} who wants to rule the rainforest.

data.name: The Shrieker Garden

entries: {@b Adventurous. Delivery. Forest Road.}

Lead your party down the garden path with this perilous plant delivery. The journey comes with some twists, turns and thorny puzzles that will require the group to pay close attention to the curious, magical environment that they venture into.

"You've spent the morning at a lively farmer's market sampling delicious, fresh produce and admiring local crafts. One stallholder asked if you'd be willing to make a delivery for her, transporting rare, and potentially dangerous, plants to a regular customer who lives deep in a nearby forest. With a fee agreed, it's now time to pick up the goods."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, introduce Hortense, then continue:
{@b Finding Flora}

items: Hortense reads out Godri's order. The party must load crates containing six {@creature Shrieker Fungus|XMM|Shrieker Fungi}, twelve {@creature Violet Fungus||Violet Funguses} and six {@creature Awakened Shrub||Awakened Shrubs} onto a cart onto a cart pulled by a {@creature Giant Goat}. They can then start their journey.
The party were told to follow a signpost on the tallest tree in the forest. The sign's riddle leads to more riddles, then to the outskirts of Godri's home.

entries: {@b Fighting Fauna}

items: While traversing the forest, a {@creature Weasel} gets into the crates and causes the Shriekers to start shrieking.

The noise attracts five {@creature Dire Wolf||Dire Wolves}, panicking the Giant Goat and causing the cart to spill its contents. The party must defend the cargo, catch the Awakend Shurbs, and avoid the Violet Funguses.

entries: {@b Final Fulfilment}

items: Two {@creature Shambling Mound||Shambling Mounds} defend Godri's garden from intruders. After a round of combat, Godri appears and the plants relax.
Godri pays the party and happily shows them around his garden.

entries: {@b Hortense Linbriggs}
{@i Human-Orc, Female, 62 ({@creature Commoner})}
Hortense is the manager of a plant wholesale business specialising in unusual, magical plants.
"Hortense rubs her muddy hands on a primrose apron advertising 'Linbriggs Valley Farm'."
{@b Godri Chevre}
{@i Elf, Male, 347 ({@creature Druid})}
This shy hedge wizard is trusted by the townsfolk, but prefers to live away from the hustle and bustle.
"Godri wears linen work clothes; the natural dyes have a strong, pleasantly herbal scent."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Magical Forest}

The roots on the ground hinder progress, and act as if an {@spell Entangle} spell has been cast. The riddle signs are hung on giant redwood trees. Two bridges cross the river. The first one the party use is an illusion maintained by the {@creature Satyr||Satyrs} who live nearby.
{@b Godri's Home}

Godri lives and works in a warren of treehouses. The forest roots are even more perilous here, and act as if a {@spell Spike Growth} spell has been cast. The garden is bordered by a woven wicker fence, which is patrolled by the {@creature Shambling Mound} and two {@creature Awakened Shrub||Awakened Shrubs}.

items: Riddle 1: What has a mouth, but never eats, and a bed, but never sleeps? (The party must cross a River.)
Riddle 2: Which flowers are likely to prompt a kiss? (The party must walk towards a patch of Tulips.)
Riddle 3: I run around the field, not going inside or out, or even moving. (The party must jump a Fence.)
Godri's garden contains a mix of medicinal, edible and poisonous plants; all are very well labelled.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Hortense pays the party 50gp as an upfront courier fee; Godri pays 140gp to the party on arrival and a bonus 40gp if all the stock is intact. If the party take a full three-hour tour of Godri's garden, he will gift them an enchanted pond pebble ({@item Ioun Stone, Protection||Ioun Stone of Protection}).

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You could halve the plants in the cart and reduce the {@creature Dire Wolf||Dire Wolves} to three.
{@b Harder}
Try increasing the number of Dire Wolves to eight and replacing the {@creature Awakened Shrub||Awakened Shrubs} with {@creature Awakened Tree||Awakened Trees}.

data.name: Welcome Home

entries: {@b Spooky. Confrontation. Overgrown Mansion.}

A leek farmer recently inherited a mansion from a long-lost relative. After years of neglect, however, the forest has started to reclaim the house. In addition to rats and creepy crawlies, the mansion hides many secrets about its previous inhabitants...

"You were recently approached by a leek farmer called Kristofer. After inheriting a mansion from a relative he had never met, he offered you a high fee to help him clear it out. Apparently, the house was overgrown, and the Land Registry advised that professional help would be needed to remove the pests. You agreed, and have made your way there."

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have the party meet Kristofer near the mansion and approach it together, then continue:
{@b Tidying Up}

items: The doors and windows of the mansion are locked, so the party must find a way to enter the house.

In the mansion, the party can begin clearing the home. For the first five rooms accessed, populate them with the following: 1. {@dice 1d6} {@creature Swarm of Rats||Swarms of Rats}; 2. {@dice 1d8} {@creature Giant Centipede||Giant Centipedes}; 3. thick spiders' {@spell Web}; 4. one {@creature Shambling Mound}; 5. ten harmless mice.
The party hear banging from underneath them. It is coming from the secret basement, the door to which is behind a globe table in Valyra's study.

entries: {@b Studying The Clues}

items: Valyra's study is protected by a {@spell Glyph of Warding}.
Papers found in Valyra's study reveal that she was looking for ways to bring her husband back to life. She had many failed attempts and one success.

entries: {@b Home Truths}

items: In the basement, the party find both Valyra and Rossi as stumbling {@creature Flesh Golem||Flesh Golems}. The pair cannot speak, but make long, drawn-out moans as they see the group. They attack the party on sight.

entries: {@b New Beginnings}

items: With Valyra and Rossi defeated, a wistful Kristofer asks the party to help him bring the pair outside, dig two graves and say a few words at the burial.
Kristofer rewards the party and offers his heartfelt thanks; he then starts sweeping up and repairing his new home.

entries: {@b Kristofer Lillandi}
{@i Human, Male, 45 ({@creature Commoner})}
Recently inherited his great-great-aunt's mansion in the woods, and her fortune, as her only known heir.
"Kristofer is a portly farmer wearing scruffy, mud-stained overalls and a straw hat. He often coughs loudly into a purple handkerchief."
{@b Valyra Artichaut}
{@i Human, Female, 141 ({@creature Flesh Golem})}
After years of research, Valyra found a way for her and her beloved husband to be together forever.
"Valyra's vacant eyes and blank expression offer no emotion. Gems and wires are buried in her skull, and she walks with unsteady steps."
{@b Rossi Artichaut}
{@i Human, Male, 148 ({@creature Flesh Golem})}
Rossi sadly died young, shortly after marrying Valyra. The newlyweds had just moved in the mansion.
"Rossi is dressed in a tuxedo soiled with blood. Wounds from failed trials scar his sallow skin."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Artichaut Mansion}

This old mansion was purchased by Valyra and Rossi when they married. After Rossi died, Valyra lived alone here for years. Some portraits hanging in the halls show the young couple together; more recent ones are just of Valyra.
{@b Mansion Basement}

Chains and crates from past experiments litter the area, as well as toxic fumes from spilled chemicals (as per the {@spell Stinking Cloud} spell). Valyra and Rossi's fleshy forms were locked in the basement after the secret door closed behind them.

items: Valyra didn't have children; as the great-grandchild of her sister, Kristofer is her oldest surviving heir.
Kristofer hadn't even heard of the Artichauts, as the two branches of the family became estranged.
Artichaut Mansion wasn't reported vacant for some time, due to its secluded position in the forest.
Once Valyra revived Rossi Artichaut as a reanimated corpse, she performed the same magic on herself.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Kristofer rewards the party with 400gp from his fortune and a {@item Ring of X-Ray Vision} found in the study. The six teal zircon gems (35gp each) and two reels of silver wiring (10gp each) attached to Valyra and Rossi can be removed, but could easily be destroyed while doing so.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
Valyra and Rossi could be {@creature Mummy||Mummies}, and the {@creature Shambling Mound} could be replaced with {@dice 1d12} {@creature Awakened Shrub||Awakened Shrubs}.
{@b Harder}
Valyra could have become a {@creature Vampire}, and used her new powers to resurrect Rossi as a {@creature Vampire Spawn}.

data.name: A Dog's Dinner

entries: {@b Thrilling. Acquisition. Quaint Cottage.}

Young Lindamill has lost her pet dog! This is no ordinary pooch predicament, however, as the hapless hound has a habit of teleporting when it gets scared. Could the dog's eagerness to escape suggest there is more to this young owner than first meets the eye?

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "The once easy-to-follow path through the forest begins to meander and fork the further in you travel. You track the road as best you can but, after an hour or so, you begin to feel as though you are treading familiar ground. Suddenly, your concentration is shattered by an ear-piercing shriek nearby, followed by shouts and yells. Leaving the path behind, you sprint in the direction of the scream, and find two sobbing figures outside a small cottage."

The party find a worried grandmother calling for a dog. She explains that her granddaughter's beloved pet has accidentally run away. The animal was a gift from the girl's late father, and it means a great deal to them both. In truth, the two women are {@creature Green Hag||Green Hags} who were hoping to enjoy the {@creature Blink Dog} in a stew later this evening. If the party aren't too careful, they might also be invited into the hags' hut for a bite...

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have the party meet Gertruda and Lindamill near their hut, then continue:
{@b Barking up the Wrong Tree}

items: A wistful Gertruda explains that her granddaughter has lost her dog. Lindamill offers the party her late father's gold in return for her precious Poochykins.

Dog tracks lead to an old cherry tree; Poochykins is at the top. The party must find a way to get the dog down, while avoiding the {@creature Swarm of Insects} and {@creature Giant Wasp} queen who are nesting in a knothole.
Just as he is rescued, Poochykins teleports to the bottom of the tree and runs into the forest.

entries: {@b A Dire Situation}

items: Poochykins is found near a den of two snarling, territorial Dire Wolves who see him as a threat.

The {@creature Dire Wolf||Dire Wolves} attack Poochykins when the party arrive. He teleports away when the fighting starts, but returns to the scene shortly after. Now that he trusts the party, he will follow them back.

entries: {@b Dog Eat Dog}

items: Back at the hags' hut, the door is open, and a sad scene is visible. The hags have created an illusion of their disguised selves wounded and crying for help. The hags will trap and ambush the party from behind the door when they enter the hut, hoping to cook them with the {@creature Blink Dog}.
As well as using their claws in the fight, the hags will try to shove players into their hot cauldron.
Once the hags are defeated, {@condition restrained} or scared off, the party will have access to their loot.

entries: {@b Gertruda Sludgewit}
{@i Green Hag, Female, 825 ({@creature Green Hag})}
Gertruda is wearing the illusory disguise of a worried grandmother. She is manipulative and self-centred.
"A forlorn grimace burdens this grandmother's face. She has wrapped a shabby blanket around her shoulders to shield her from the elements."
{@b Lindamill Wriggletoe}
{@i Green Hag, Female, 748 ({@creature Green Hag})}
Lindamill is wearing the illusory disguise of a sobbing 10-year-old girl. Her favourite meal is Blink Dog legs.
"Tears pour down Lindamill's face and land on her grey jumper. She is crying inconsolably and cradling her dog's chewed blanket."
{@b Poochykins}
{@i Blink Dog, Male, 6 ({@creature Blink Dog})}
This dog was held by the hags for two hours until, to their horror, it teleported away and escaped them.
"A melancholy dog with amber markings. Its slobbery tongue frequently licks its wet nose."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b The Hags' Hut}
"This quaint cottage is made from chunky, stone bricks. Ivy crawls up the slender chimney flue, which lets out a gentle stream of white smoke."

When the party first meet the hags, the hut will look cosy and inviting because of illusory magic. The interior of the hut features a bloody dining table, a fireplace with a bubbling cauldron, hanging bones, wicker baskets and a chest.
{@b Large Cherry Tree}

"Clearly centuries old, this sturdy tree towers boastfully above its kin. The tree's wide branches and gaping knotholes house chirping birds and fluffy squirrels, who send fluttering, pink blossom drifting to the floor below."
The tree sits at around 40 ft tall, and provides fruit to the animals and insects that inhabit its branches. A hidden wasps' nest will surprise anyone who climbs the tree.
{@b Dire Wolf Den}
"Eventually, the forest opens to reveal a grassy clearing. An upturned tree over a shallow trench has created the perfect den for a pair of Dire Wolves."

The {@creature Dire Wolf||Dire Wolves} will emerge from their trench, growling, and circle Poochykins until the party step in. As soon as the party arrive, the Dire Wolves will lunge at Poochykins, but the Dire Wolves will quickly turn their attention to the party.

items: If the party refuse to help, they still meet the {@creature Blink Dog} in the forest; the {@creature Green Hag||hags} later try to steal it back.
The hags disguise themselves as the cottage's former residents, whom they ate many years ago.
The Blink Dog's owner was taking him for a walk, but was attacked and eaten by the hags.
The hags don't eat every passer-by, they trick them into tragic bargains for entertainment, too.
Gertruda prefers {@creature Dire Wolf} meat to Blink Dog or humanoid meat, but it's more dangerous to gather.
The Dire Wolves' den used to belong to a group of badgers who lost a fight for the territory.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: A chest made from old wood sits in the hags' hut, holding 246gp and 91sp that they have pilfered from their victims. A canvas sack hooked to Lindamill's belt is a tattered {@item Bag of Tricks}; Gertruda keeps 4pp hidden in her shoe, unbeknownst to Lindamill.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
Lindamill could be the only {@creature Green Hag||hag} who lives in the hut; Poochykins may help the party fight her.
{@b Harder}
An additional hag could turn the group into a coven and give them extra spells. You could also swap the {@creature Dire Wolf||Dire Wolves} for {@creature Giant Scorpion||Giant Scorpions}.

data.name: Trouble Brewing

entries: {@b Thrilling. Confrontation. Cider Distillery.}

The party are invited to an exclusive tour of a new, state-of-the-art, magically operated distillery. When they arrive, the site is in chaos and the other guests are at the mercy of malfunctioning equipment. Will the party's day end in a successful shutdown or a total meltdown?

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "The smell of damp soil after rain fills the air as you travel the final stretch of road towards the Oakswood Orchard and Distillery. You were lucky enough to win invitations to a VIP tour of the brand new, magically autonomous factory before the grand opening, but unlucky enough to be held up by bad weather on the way there. You're running late, but hopefully you can still join the tour."

The Oakswood Orchard and Distillery is owned by Pomeroy Oakswood. He has no particular passion for apples or the beverages they produce, and prizes profit above product. When the party make it to the distillery, they will find that the animated, magical constructs that operate the facility have gone haywire due to a lightning strike from this morning's storm. The {@creature Mage} responsible for the distillery's arcane processes is struggling to regain order, and important guests are in grave danger.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, describe the party's approach to the distillery gates, then continue:
{@b Touch of Sharpness}

items: The party see six sets of animated garden shears ({@creature Animated Flying Sword|XMM|Animated Flying Swords}) flying around the gates. Pomeroy begs for help, offering gold and free cider in return.
Once the shears are stopped, Pomeroy explains that the magical constructs that normally operate the distillery have gone totally haywire.

entries: {@b Notes of Fresh Fruit}

items: Suddenly, screams are heard from the orchard. Three VIPs, including Eliya, are hiding in a tree while Aldur tries to fend off eight robotic apple pickers ({@creature Animated Armor|XMM|Animated Armour}). He needs urgent help.
Once the guests are safe, Aldur explains that a lightning strike caused the arcane controls to malfunction. The only way to shut everything down safely is to destroy the central control panel.

entries: {@b Flavour Explosion}

items: The control panel is at the far end of the factory floor. It is protected by a hostile {@creature Shield Guardian}.

At the start of each round, scalding steam will be fired out of the overheating machinery. At the start of the second round, a vat will also spill cider over the floor as if the {@spell Grease} spell has been cast.

entries: {@b Sweet Aftertaste}

items: Once the controls are destroyed, the constructs shut down. Pomeroy declares the business is over.
Eliya offers to buy the distillery (at a low price). She fires Pomeroy, promotes Aldur and pays the party.

entries: {@b Pomeroy Oakswood}
{@i Elf, Male, 356 ({@creature Noble})}
An egotistical business owner who talks a lot, but doesn't really understand the industry he is in.
"Pomeroy's side parting is dishevelled and his fine clothes are covered in dust. A look of terror stretches across his well-groomed face."
{@b Aldur Leafson}
{@i Gnome, Male, 35 ({@creature Mage})}
The distillery's mechanic, and sole voice of reason. Aldur is highly overworked and underappreciated.
"Aldur wears thick, mirrored goggles and rarely removes them. His bright-orange overalls are scorched from the magic he has had to cast."
{@b Eliya Everclear}
{@i Elf, Female, 501 ({@creature Noble})}
A wealthy investor who specialises in food and drink. She has a shrewd eye for true talent.
"Despite the leaves stuck in her hair and cracked glasses, she seems oddly composed."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Distillery Gates}
"Large iron gates topped with the words 'Oakswood Orchard and Distillery' greet you. Past the gates, you can see big stone buildings and fields of fruitful apple trees."
Pomeroy is on the other side of the gates, calling out for help. Blocking access to the gates are six sets of wildly snapping garden shears that will attack the party when they try and get past.
{@b Oakswood Orchard}
"The orchard floor is sticky with crushed fruit. At the far end of the field, a team of shiny copper constructs are attempting to rip scared guests out of a tree."

Aldur has already disabled two constructs, but has used up most of his magic for the day to do so. The three VIPs climbed the apple tree when Aldur suggested they did so. The tree will last two rounds before the apple pickers break it down.
{@b Factory Floor}
"The heat is overwhelming. You can barely hear yourself think over the bangs and high-pitched whistles coming out of the pressurised machinery."

The {@creature Shield Guardian} is normally used to carry barrels. It is haywire and has cast the {@spell Haste} spell on itself for the fight with the party. The control panel has AC 18 and 30 HP. Once it is destroyed, the Shield Guardian will power down.

items: Pomeroy invited the party because he heard a rumour that they had recently acquired wealth.
There are three other VIP guests: a local food critic, a safety inspector, and Eliya, a rich investor.
Pomeroy has spent a fortune building the factory and now needs help with its high running costs.
The flying garden shears at the gate are meant to prune the orchard and the distillery grounds.
Pomeroy was fleeing the scene when the party arrived, desperately trying to save himself.
Aldur warned Pomeroy that more than one {@creature Mage} was needed to run a factory this sophisticated.
Aldur wanted to install safety precautions, but Pomery rejected the plan as too expensive.
Pomeroy's cider recipe isn't well-balanced; the drink is cloudy, and it tastes like vinegar.
Aldur bought the automated workers from an artificer, but has significantly upgraded them all.
Aldur would love to own and run a distillery or factory of his own some day.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: Once the distillery is powered down, Eliya gives the party a banknote they can cash in for 750gp for their help. Aldur promises to name a future product in the party's honour, and hands them one of the {@item Immovable Rod||Immovable Rods} from the ransacked factory floor.

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
You can reduce the number of {@creature Animated Armor|XMM|Animated Armour} apple pickers to six, and use regular stats for the {@creature Shield Guardian}.
{@b Harder}
Have two {@creature Shield Guardian||Shield Guardians} working in the main room of the distillery, and more shears outside.

data.name: Nightmare Glade

entries: {@b Adventurous. Confrontation. Corrupted Forest.}

An innocent mistake has allowed fiendish horses, known as {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares}, to infiltrate a sacred forest and drive away the {@creature Unicorn} who normally resides there. The {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares}' presence is corrupting the forest, and will continue to do so, until the fiends are defeated.

entries.name: Starting the Adventure

entries: "The Brightglade Clearing is a site of exceptional beauty, with a special connection to the gods. You have sought out the fabled glade, intrigued by stories of worthy visitors who were granted blessings by the site's legendary guardian. As you reach the edge of the forest, you see a small stone shrine containing an oil-burning lantern. A figure kneels in front of the lantern, dressed in pale-blue robes."

The figure, Lorans, is a recent recruit to the Wardens of Brightglade, an order dedicated to shielding the forest from evil. Last night, he accidentally allowed a sacred lantern to go out. Some time after relighting the lantern, Lorans ventured into the forest to investigate a strong smell of charred wood. He saw that fiendish horses have infiltrated the forest's most sacred glade and driven away its {@creature Unicorn} guardian. Fearing his mistake caused this problem, Lorans fled back to the shrine to pray for help.

entries.name: Suggested Story
entries: Set the scene, have Lorans call out to the party and regretfully explain his mistake, then continue:
{@b Clerical Error}

items: Lorans tells the party that the {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares} can be found in the {@creature Unicorn||Unicorn's} glade. He warns the party that the forest is becoming corrupted by evil.

entries: {@b Corrupted Environment}

items: The party notice the wildlife is on edge as they travel deeper into the forest. They may fall into a snake pit, home to three hostile {@creature Giant Venomous Snake|XMM|Giant Venomous Snakes} and a {@creature Swarm of Venomous Snakes|XMM}.

After escaping the snakes, the party find the clearing. It is surrounded by a {@spell Wall of Fire} spell. Flames lash out and plumes of smoke make it difficult to breathe. They must find a way through.

entries: {@b Fight for the Forest}

items: Entering the glade, the party are attacked by five Nightmares. Once only one fiend remains, the Unicorn returns and fights alongside the party.
When the final Nightmare is destroyed, the Unicorn begins restoring the glade to its normal state. Lorans will also appear to thank the party.

entries: {@b Warden Lorans Kimwitu}
{@i Dwarf, Male, 28 ({@creature Priest Acolyte|XMM})}
Lorans is guilt-ridden over his mistake. He believes the party are the answer to his fervent prayers.
"Red eyes and snotty patches on the sleeves of his robes show that this cleric has been crying."
{@b The Brightglade Guardian}
{@i Unicorn, 1000+ ({@creature Unicorn})}
The celestial protector of this area, the unicorn moves with a noble grace and restrained strength.
"Light bounces off a snow-white coat, giving the creature a curious, shimmering aura."

entries.name: Key Locations
entries: {@b Corrupted Forest}
"Tall trees cast shadows across the path and an unnatural chill fills the air. Animal howls echo unnervingly, taunting you with their uncertain direction."

As the party enter the forest, they must navigate foliage that acts like the {@spell Spike Growth} spell. The dark trees and thick brambles make the way forward disorientating. Skittish creatures charge past the party, building tension and fear.
{@b Snake Pit}
"The ground beneath you writhes, as you realise you have fallen on a slithering, hissing group of snakes. You struggle to find your footing on the uneven surface."

The forest's dark shadows and a number of charred, fallen leaves obscure the snake pit, making it difficult to spot and avoid. The loose dirt walls of the 10 ft hole are challenging to climb. The soil at the edge of the pit is also unstable.
{@b Brightglade Clearing}
"A ring of silver birch trees marks the edge of the glade. The thin, pale trunks blaze with sinister, crackling flames."

The burning trees create a wall of magical fire that the party cannot see through. Five {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares} can be found within the circular glade. Once the fiendish Nightmares are destroyed, the {@creature Unicorn||Unicorn's} presence begins to return the space to a site of stunning, natural beauty.

items: Novice warden Lorans visits the shrine daily to tend to the lantern and leave other offerings.
Lorans forgot to replace the glass shade on the lantern after cleaning it, causing the flame to die.
Legend says if the lantern goes out, fiends will be able to use the forest as an interplanar gateway.
The {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares} can be tracked by following hoofmarks scorched into the forest floor.
The {@creature Unicorn} generally resides in the centre of the forest, where its celestial power is strongest.
The {@creature Unicorn} may choose to appear earlier, if any of the party fall unconscious and need healing.

entries.name: Quest Rewards
entries: The {@creature Unicorn} will use any remaining healing actions to restore the party members. It will also create a flower for each of them. Lorans will gift them 154gp from the shrine's offerings pot, and a consecrated {@item Candle of Invocation} (Lawful Good).

entries.name: Level Changes
entries: {@b Easier}
Try reducing the number of {@creature Nightmare||Nightmares}, and replacing the {@spell Wall of Fire} with a {@spell Wall of Force}.
{@b Harder}
Instead of five Nightmares, the glade could be occupied by three Nightmares and a flaming {@creature Vrock} whose presence is poisoning the forest.
